intro: Caxamarca sanchezii, commonly known as the Sánchez's caxamarca, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Peruvian Andes. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family, and is characterized by its striking, bright red flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its foliage is lance-shaped with a smooth texture, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
